snippet: Victims sought to prosecute Benedict XVI and others for what they called a worldwide cover-up of sexual abuse amounting to “crimes against humanity.”
abstract: International Criminal Court in The Hague says it will not investigate or prosecute former Pope Benedict XVI and other leaders of the Roman Catholic Church on allegations of covering up sexual abuse of children by priests; lawyers for victims, who filed suit in 2011, say outcome was expected but case has still raised profile of important issue.
lead_paragraph: Victims sought to prosecute Benedict XVI and others for what they called a worldwide cover-up of sexual abuse amounting to “crimes against humanity.”

headline.main: Hague Court Declines Inquiry Into Church Abuse Cover-Up
headline.print_headline: Hague Court Turns Down Abuse Inquiry

keywords.value: Survivors Network of Those Abused by Priests
keywords.name: organizations
